title: Sampler, 1832
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on wool foundation
Technique: embroidered in counted cross and satin stitches on plain weave foundation
provenance: Ex. coll. Fraser-Martin. Donor's card notes that she purchased all five samplers from Matilda Jane Goddard in 1916 through someone in Farmington, Conn.
creditline: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection
description:
A verse and inscription at the center, surrounded by trees, flowering trees, birds and animals, with a strawberry vine border. The verse reads: 
Blessing for ever on the Lamb
Who bore the curse for wretched man
Let angels sound his sacred name
and ev'ry creature say Amen

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1832.
1832. Medium: silk embroidery on wool foundation
Technique: embroidered in counted cross and satin stitches on plain weave foundation. Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection. 1976-100-5-d.
